results.name: Number of pairs (f,g) of endofunctions on [n] such that the composite function gf has no fixed point.
comment: Consider n boys and n girls, each boy secretly loving a girl and vice versa. The probability that no couple could be formed is a(n)/n^(2n).
a(n) is the number of pairs of binary matrices n X n (M, N), M having only one 1 per row, N having only one 1 per column, such that M + N has no coefficient equal to 2.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..214
Eric Weisstein's MathWorld, Confluent Hypergeometric Function of the Second Kind
example: For two boys A,B and two girls A',B', the a(2) possibilities are:
A loves A' who loves B who loves B' who loves A;
A loves B' who loves B who loves A' who loves A.
